summary: The Carried Interest Fairness Act of 2025 seeks to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, primarily focusing on the tax treatment of "carried interest" income earned by investment managers in pass-through entities (e.g., partnerships). The bill aims to recharacterize certain capital gains as ordinary income, limit loss deductions, and clarify rules surrounding investment services partnership interests, including dispositions and distributions. It also includes provision for penalty increases regarding underpayments of taxes related to avoiding this section.
